text: [Music]
when I write a message uh it's basically
like writing a book a week and it takes
about uh takes me about 20 hours to
write a message um and it starts I
actually have a series of steps that I
uh do on how to what I call craft a
message
and then I asked myself eight questions
about how I'm going to deliver it one of
the important things for a delivery
whether you're a teacher or a politician
or a pastor or anything is to think
about who you're going to be speaking to
so many times people ask the wrong thing
they say what what am I what should I
speak on wrong question think about who
you're going to be speaking to and then
you will know automatically what you
should speak about think about the needs
of the audience so I spend about 20
hours a week in preparation for message
when I first started it took longer than
that but now with the Advent of the
internet there's a lot of research very
easy uh with word processing very easy
even Bible software programs and now I
even have a a volunteer staff of people
who do research for me I have people who
read books for me give me summaries I
will call and say I'm looking for
illustrations on Greed I'm looking for
illustrations and they voluntarily help
me do it together so it's a really a a
uh a teamwork I also have uh a teaching
team of three other pastors at
Saddleback Church uh who teach with me
because I teach six Services every
weekend and we have two on Saturday
night two Sunday morning two Saturday
night there'll be about 20 to 22,000
people there as of this taping and so um
it it's very draining to do six Services
over and over over with emotion so I
teach half the year I teach 26 weeks and
then uh on uh the big holy days like
Easter and Christmas well this Christmas
I'm doing 14 services so I will speak 14
times in a row an hour that's 14
hours and uh I just need the glucose
injections between the services there'll
be somewhere around 45,000 people uh
coming to Service uh this this
Christmas
